description: For sale in our St. Louis showroom is a 2 owner, beautiful blue 1977 Lincoln Mark V. The odometer reads 41,260, which is the actual mileage on the car. Options for this 1977 Lincoln Mark V include: Air Conditioning, AM/FM Radio, Cruise Control, Power Brakes, Power Steering, Power Locks, Power Seats, Power Windows, Tilt Wheel, Seat Belts, Leather Interior, and White Wall Radial Tires. Powering this long blue Lincoln is the original 460 CID V8 engine, which is mated to the original 3 speed, C6 automatic transmission. A new carburetor, fuel pump, and gas tank were added during a recent tune up, as well as the white wall, radial tires that have approximately 100 miles on them. This 77' Lincoln received a respray of the original blue paint about a year ago, and looks great, as does the blue vinyl section of the roof. The light gray leather interior features blue accents throughout, and is in great condition, free from any rips, tears, or major wear. The Continental Mark V was produced and sold by the Lincoln division of Ford Motor Company from 1977 to 1979. The Mark series was a personal luxury coupe, and the Mark V was the largest version to ever be produced of any Mark series, in fact it was the largest mid-sized car ever produced. It was longer than its GM rival the Cadillac Eldorado by nearly 6 inches. During its three year production run it averaged 75,000 units sold each year, again beating the Eldorado through 1978. The Mark V differed from the Mark IV in that it featured hideaway headlights, round opera inspired windows in the sail panel, a spare tire contoured trunk lid, and the most prevalent change, the chrome plated front grille. These cars feature an incredibly long hood, 7 feet to be exact. To view this 1977 Lincoln Mark V in greater detail, including HD pictures and an HD video, visit www.GatewayClassicCars.com or our St. Louis showroom. For more information, please call 618-271-3000 or email STL@GatewayClassicCars.com

description: 1972 Lincoln Mark 1V Cartier addition, this original low mile triple white example has only 63000 original Miles, It has been in a garage in Montecito California and taken out and used sparingly. It is original and un restored, the body of the car is laser straight, the paint is excellent and original with the exception of the front driver side fender that has been resprayed in the mid 80’s due to the son moving his bike and scratched the lower panel with his pedal, the paint match is perfect and you would never know. There are no rust issues, the white padded top is like new, and the car retains all of its original stainless and chrome trim in wonderful shape.

The interior is white leather, excellent shape with only some wear to the driver side as seen in my photos, Black carpets are not soiled nor torn, headliner, dash, as well as door panels also in that almost perfect shape. All power items are working correct such as seats, windows, lights and The AC blows Ice cold, the headlight covers operate as they should The steering wheel is in good condition and the horn ring works. The trunk is original and carries its spare and jack, included also are full service books still in the wrappers, original Lincoln brochures, as well as the warranty books. The car has been stored inside so there is minimal sun fade to any of the interior including the gauges.  I have three sets of original keys.

The motor runs smooth, there are no leaks, no strange noises, the car runs quiet and shifts effortlessly through all gears, the brakes work well and the car is aligned properly, a joy to drive on the highway. I see no issues driving this car, I have taken many photos but if there is something that I did not cover I am happy to send the photo of what you are looking for. Inspections are welcome.

description: Offered here is a clean and well-kept 1974 Lincoln Continental Mark IV 2-Door Coupe for consideration. Even in the 1970's, Lincoln's were the standard for luxury vehicles, and this example is no exception. This Mark IV has spent the last two decades in Virginia, owned by a Lincoln enthusiast who recently passed away. The car remains all-original and the 36,255 miles recorded are believed to be true.    The car is finished in the original Black (code 1C) paint over the original Red Leather (code BD) interior trim. It is powered by the original, numbers matching 460ci V8 4bbl engine (A code) mated to an automatic transmission. Noteworthy features include power windows, power seats, power locks, hide-a-way headlights, original radio, wood trim, Cartier analog clock, cruise control, power antenna, rear port hole windows, white wall tires, spare tire and jack, and an assortment of extra parts. It even comes with the original owners manual, build sheet, and original keys.    It is unique find and starts, runs, and drives exceptionally well. Basically floats down the road. You will be hard-pressed to find another one this clean and this original at the price offered here. Call or e-mail if interested, or to make a reasonable offer. Thank you for looking. title: 1977 Lincoln Continental

description: Remember when Lincolns were the cars of choice for the most grueling races of the 1950s? Yes, Lincolns! Cars like this 1954 Lincoln Capri were renowned for their big horsepower, tidy handling, and bulletproof construction, making them a favorite among competitors in the grueling (and deadly) Carrera Panamericana cross-country races held in Mexico.

Of course, this handsome Capri sedan was never a race car, but the same virtues that made it popular with racers also serve it well on the streets. The tidy proportions bely the massive luxury machines Lincoln would become later in the decade, but the upscale design and ornamentation leave no doubt that this was a top-of-the-line car in 1954. The Ivy Green paint is a refreshing change from the pastels and plain black sedans of the period, and helps the car stand out without being undignified, which wouldn't suit a Lincoln at all. Finish quality is excellent and it's just a quick polish and wax away from being truly spectacular. It's got a great shine and the bodywork underneath is laser-straight, suggesting it has never been wrecked or rusty, and all four doors close with that incredibly solid ker-chunk sound that is always so reassuring. Plenty of chrome and stainless trim ensures nobody will mistake this for anything but a Lincoln, and it remains in first-class condition throughout, including the wonderful taillight housings and ornaments ahead of the rear wheels.

We have a lot of reasons to believe the interior is original, from the handsome patterned cloth upholstery to the ornate tri-tone door panels that blend into the dashboard. It's possible that the carpets have been replaced at some point, but even they have some patina that makes everything look consistent. It's loaded with power options, which should be expected on a car of this stature, including a power seat, power windows, and cold A/C, which appears to be an early add-on unit under the dash and not built into the trunk the way the factory would have done it. Either way, it's effective and most of the hardware tucks neatly out of sight. Sliding levers for the ventilation controls, an array of simple gauges, and an AM radio built into the dash instead of simply jammed into a slot all give it a very neatly finished look. We especially like the patterned applique that covers the glove box and wraps into the door panels, making the Capri feel light-hearted and not at all frumpy like most luxury cars of the period. And you do get a giant truck with an original mat and full-sized spare with jack assembly.

The 317 cubic inch V8 was all-new in 1954 and with overhead valves, power was way up over the flathead before it. The unusual exhaust manifold arrangement makes it easy to spot, and it appears to be mostly original under the hood, including the gold air cleaner and valve covers. You'll find both power brakes and power steering on the options list, and someone has insulated the fenders and air intake to make th

description: For sale in our Nashville Tennessee showroom is an ultra-rare titanic of a car, the 1979 Lincoln Continental Mark V for sale. This beautiful and luxurious Continental is the definition of luxury, feast your eyes on this Numbers matching land yacht with only 40,791 actual miles. This 79' Lincoln Mark V for sale is likely to be one of the cleanest and ready to roll left in existence. Powered by a 400-cubic Inch V8 engine that is ready to pull that camper or boat over the mountains just like in the 70Ã¢??S, this 79' Lincoln Continental Mark V for sale has plenty of pep in its step with all of the ponies hammering away, Piston power and there is no replacement for displacement. With plenty of low end torque, this Lincoln is one easy moving land yacht and, I want you to be prepared to lean back and relax as you float down the road. Backing the mighty 400 Cubic inch V8 is a 3-speed automatic transmission, built for smooth shift and smooth sailing.  This 1979 Lincoln Mark V for sale is ready for a pleasure cruise and to make the road its partner for life, on hot days enjoy the ice-cold air conditioning that you could hang meat in. The exterior is a deep and dark stunning shade of burgundy or maroon, depending on what type of light you are in, match this with the deep gloss finish that gives the effect that it is still wet and about to drip off the car and you now have an eye popping paint job. With long line that stretch down the fenders and added gills on each side, this boat looks like a great white shark motoring down the road. The interior makes you feel regal, with a gorgeous soft and plush red cloth interior. If driving in the utmost comfort is your goal, this is the car for you! As you look at the factory gauge cluster, you can't help but notice how enticing this car is, it screams and begs for you to take it for a ride, with enough room for your friends and family you'll be surprised when you find out that this Lincoln doesn't come with a guest bed or bath! This 1979 Lincoln Mark V was built as a pure luxury sedan and it can be seen in vivid detail, through this magnificently kept original classic Lincoln for sale. Options and features in this 1979 Lincoln Continental Mark V for sale, includes: A/C, AM/FM radio, Cruise Control, Power Brakes, Horse Power, Power Steering, Power locks, Power seats, Power Windows, tilt wheel, seat belts, Plush Cloth interior, and aluminum/alloy wheels wrapped in whitewall radial tires. Now's your chance to own a rare Lincoln collectors piece. Whether you're looking for a weekend cruiser, show piece, or a car for the whole family, this is the Lincoln for you! To see more HD pictures and video please visit GatewayClassicCars.com. For more information please call the Nashville showroom at 615-900-9679 or e-mail us at Nashville@GatewayClassicCars.com.

description: 1972 Lincoln Continental Cartier
Low original mile car from a private collection!
Beautiful!
Does it get any better than a big block, rear wheel drive, long nosed, Detroit steeled, Luxury Carriage by one of America's Premier Automotive Builders?

Probably not  unless comparing to winning the Power Ball and celebrating the win in your very own private yacht with any of the top three supermodels of your choice.  -- There I go wondering off again...,,, --
Back to reality;
The Lincoln is all engine with the huge 460ci good 'ol Ford blue under hood, it provides plenty of power and smooth stump pulling torque.
Transmission is velvety smooth and brings you up to speed effortlessly.
Notice the interior and how clean it is, Cartier luxury abounds inside and the subtle touches of luxury are appreciated throughout.
The body lines are nice and crisp.  The Lincoln shows well with plenty of shine and it obviously sports the humped trunk like a hidden Continental kit true to its namesake.
The Chrome is all in good shape as is the stainless steel and moldings throughout.
No disappointments in this beautiful Lincoln Continental!

For 1972, Lincoln offered two models, the Lincoln Continental and the Continental Mark IV Series. The Continental had a 127 inch wheelbase while the Mark IV had a 120.4 inch platform. The base engine was an overhead valve V8 displacing 460 CID and offering 212 SAE horsepower. The Mark IV engine was a 460 CID with overhead valves and 224 SAE horsepower.

The most distinguishable feature of the two series were the grilles and the headlights. The Continental had a new criss-cross pattern grille and a hood ornament with Lincoln emblem. Standard equipment included fender skirts, automatic temperature control air conditioning, power front disc brakes, cut-pile carpeting, electric clock, carpeted luggage compartment, left-hand remote-control outside rearview mirror, armrests, tinted glass, AM radio with power antenna, two-way power seat, visor vanity mirror, power windows and seat belts, and power ventilation.
Pricing for the 2-door hardtop coupe Continental began at $7,065 while the 4-door sedan sold for $7,300. A total of 10,408 hardtop coupes were produced and 35,561 of the sedan.

The Mark IV Series was four inches longer, slightly lower, and an inch wider the 1971 version. The radiator-style grille was longer and used fewer vertical bars. It had a Mark IV emblem with a hood ornament on top. They featured a new roof design with an oblong opera window. Four rectangular bumper integrated taillights replaced the vertical wraparound ones.

In the back of the Mark IV was the unique spare tire hump. They came equipped with Sure-Track power brake system, spare tire cover, luxury wheel covers, Cartier electric clock, Six-Way power Twin Comfort lounge seat, vinyl roof and automatic seatback release.

The Continental was sold to the rich and famous. Anyone who could afford the cost was welcome. Famous buyers included Elvis Presley, Frank Sinatra, Louie Prima, Dwight Eisenhower, Barry Goldwater, Spike Jones, Nelson Rockefeller, Henry J. Kaiser, Howard Johnson, the Shah of Iran, and many other celebrities owned them.
These beautiful Road Luxury Cruisers Continue to rise in value with it's biggest growth so far over the past 2 years.
